thread.title: Grammys 2017: David Bowie's saxophonist says icon 'should have' been nominated in more categories
thread.title_full: Grammys 2017: David Bowie's saxophonist says icon 'should have' been nominated in more categories

author: Ben Travis
title: Grammys 2017: David Bowie's saxophonist says icon 'should have' been nominated in more categories
text:
Grammys 2017: David Bowie’s saxophonist says icon ‘should have’ been nominated in more categories 
The legendary musician received five awards including Best Rock Song Monday 13 February 2017 09:39 GMT Click to followES Entertainment Posthumous prizes: Donny McCaslin collects David Bowie's awards at the Grammys 2017 Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP 
David Bowie ’s saxophonist Donny McCaslin said the musical icon should have been nominated for more awards at the Grammys . 
Bowie received five posthumous awards at the 2017 ceremony, including Best Alternative Music Album and Best Engineered Album for his final record Blackstar. 
The physical record was awarded Best Recording Package, while the album’s title track was named Best Rock Song as well as Best Rock Performance. 
McCaslin collected Bowie’s awards on his behalf, donning a t-shirt with the Blackstar logo. Grammy Awards 2017 - In pictures Grammy Awards 2017 - In pictures 1/70 
Adele poses in the press room with the awards for album of the year for "25", song of the year for "Hello", record of the year for "Hello", best pop solo performance for "Hello", and best pop vocal album for "25" at the 59th annual Grammy Awards Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP 2/70

Speaking backstage after the ceremony, McCaslin said: “I’ll start by saying that nobody could represent David Bowie, but I’m glad to be here to represent him.
